sentences.zh: 孝文皇帝，高祖中子也。

translations.text: Emperor Wen was the middle son of Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 高祖十一年春，已破陳豨軍，定代地，立為代王，都中都。

translations.text: In the eleventh year of Gaozu, after he had already defeated the army of Chen Xi and pacified the land of Dai, he established him as King of Dai, with his capital at Zhongdu.

sentences.zh: 太后薄氏子。

translations.text: He was the son of Empress Bo.

sentences.zh: 即位十七年，高后八年七月，高后崩。

translations.text: He ascended the throne in the seventeenth year of Gaozu, the eighth year of Empress Lu.

sentences.zh: 九月，諸呂呂產等欲為亂，以危劉氏，大臣共誅之，謀召立代王，事在呂后語中。

translations.text: In the seventh month, Empress Lu died, and the Lü clan, Lü Chan and others, intended to rebel to endanger the Liu clan, so the ministers all plotted to kill them, and planned to summon and establish the King of Dai, the matters are recorded in the account of Empress Lu.

Emperor Wen was the middle son of Gaozu. In the eleventh year of Gaozu, after he had already defeated the army of Chen Xi and pacified the land of Dai, he established him as King of Dai, with his capital at Zhongdu. He was the son of Empress Bo. He ascended the throne in the seventeenth year of Gaozu, the eighth year of Empress Lu. In the seventh month, Empress Lu died, and the Lü clan, Lü Chan and others, intended to rebel to endanger the Liu clan, so the ministers all plotted to kill them, and planned to summon and establish the King of Dai, the matters are recorded in the account of Empress Lu.

sentences.zh: 丞相陳平、太尉周勃等使人迎代王。

translations.text: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo and others sent people to welcome the King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 代王問左右郎中令張武等。

translations.text: The King of Dai consulted with his attendants, the Zhongwei Zhang Wu and others.

sentences.zh: 張武等議曰：「漢大臣皆故高帝時大將，習兵，多謀詐，此其屬意非止此也，特畏高帝、呂太后威耳。

translations.text: Zhang Wu and others advised: 'All the Han ministers are old generals of Gaozu's time, skilled in military affairs and full of cunning stratagems, this is not just their intention to do this, they merely fear the authority of Gaozu and Empress Lu.

sentences.zh: 今已誅諸呂，新啑血京師，此以迎大王為名，實不可信。

translations.text: Now that they have already killed the Lü clan and shed fresh blood in the capital, this welcoming Your Majesty is just a pretext, in reality it cannot be trusted.'

sentences.zh: 願大王稱疾毋往，以觀其變。」

translations.text: 'We urge Your Majesty to feign illness and not go, to observe how events develop.'

sentences.zh: 中尉宋昌進曰：「群臣之議皆非也。

translations.text: Zhongwei Hong Chang advanced and said: 'The ministers' discussions are all wrong.

sentences.zh: 夫秦失其政，諸侯豪桀并起，人人自以為得之者以萬數，然卒踐天子之位者，劉氏也，天下絕望，一矣。

translations.text: When Qin lost its governance, the various feudal lords and powerful families rose up one by one, each considering himself to have the Mandate of Heaven, the number who considered themselves worthy reached tens of thousands, yet in the end, the one who ascended the imperial throne was Liu Bang, the world despaired, this is the first reason.

sentences.zh: 高帝封王子弟，地犬牙相制，此所謂盤石之宗也，天下服其彊，二矣。

translations.text: Gaozu enfeoffed his sons and younger brothers with lands in a chessboard pattern to check each other, this is called the rock-solid foundation, the world respects its strength, this is the second reason.

sentences.zh: 漢興，除秦苛政，約法令，施德惠，人人自安，難動搖，三矣。

translations.text: The Han rose and abolished Qin's harsh laws, simplified the statutes, bestowed kindness and favor, everyone felt at ease, difficult to shake, this is the third reason.

sentences.zh: 夫以呂太后之嚴，立諸呂為三王，擅權專制，然而太尉以一節入北軍，一呼士皆左袒，為劉氏，叛諸呂，卒以滅之。

translations.text: Although Empress Lu was strict and established three Lü as kings, monopolizing power and controlling everything, yet Grand Commandant Zhou Bo entered the Northern Army with a single tally, one shout and the soldiers all bared their left arms, supporting the Liu clan and rebelling against the Lü, in the end exterminating them.

sentences.zh: 此乃天授，非人力也。

translations.text: This was bestowed by Heaven, not by human effort.

sentences.zh: 今大臣雖欲為變，百姓弗為使，其黨寧能專一邪？

translations.text: Now if the ministers truly intend to rebel, the people will not support them, how can their party become unified?'

sentences.zh: 方今內有朱虛、東牟之親，外畏吳、楚、淮南、瑯邪、齊、代之彊。

translations.text: At present, internally we have the relatives Zhu Hui and Dong Mu, externally we fear the strength of Wu, Chu, Huainan, Langye, Qi, and Dai.'

sentences.zh: 方今高帝子獨淮南王與大王，大王又長，賢聖仁孝，聞於天下，故大臣因天下之心而欲迎立大王，大王勿疑也。」

translations.text: 'At present, among Gaozu's sons, only the Kings of Huainan and Dai remain, moreover Your Majesty is the elder, sage, benevolent, and filial, renowned throughout the world, therefore the ministers, following the will of the world, wish to welcome and establish Your Majesty, Your Majesty should have no doubts.'

sentences.zh: 代王報太后計之，猶與未定。

translations.text: The King of Dai reported this to the Empress Dowager, but still hesitated and could not decide.

sentences.zh: 卜之龜，卦兆得大橫。

translations.text: He divined with tortoise shell, the omen showed 'Great Horizontal'.

sentences.zh: 占曰：「大橫庚庚，余為天王，夏啟以光。」

translations.text: The interpretation said: 'Great Horizontal Geng Geng, I am the Heavenly King, Xia Yu illuminated it.'

sentences.zh: 代王曰：「寡人固已為王矣，又何王？」

translations.text: The King of Dai said: 'I am already a king, why speak of being king again?'

sentences.zh: 卜人曰：「所謂天王者乃天子。」

translations.text: The diviner said: 'What is called Heavenly King is the Son of Heaven.'

sentences.zh: 於是代王乃遣太后弟薄昭往見絳侯，絳侯等具為昭言所以迎立王意。

translations.text: Thereupon the King of Dai sent his mother's younger brother Bo Zhao to see Marquis Jiang, Jiang Hou and others fully explained to Zhao the intention of welcoming and establishing the king.

sentences.zh: 薄昭還報曰：「信矣，毋可疑者。」

translations.text: Bo Zhao returned and reported: 'It is true, there is no need to doubt.'

sentences.zh: 代王乃笑謂宋昌曰：「果如公言。」

translations.text: The King of Dai then laughed and said to Hong Chang: 'Indeed as you said.'

sentences.zh: 乃命宋昌參乘，張武等六人乘傳詣長安。

translations.text: He ordered Hong Chang to ride in the same carriage, Zhang Wu and five others to ride in the post carriage, and set out for Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 至高陵休止，而使宋昌先馳之長安觀變。

translations.text: They halted at Gaoling, and sent Hong Chang to first go to Chang'an to observe the situation.

Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo and others sent people to welcome the King of Dai. The King of Dai consulted with his attendants, the Zhongwei Zhang Wu and others. Zhang Wu and others advised: 'All the Han ministers are old generals of Gaozu's time, skilled in military affairs and full of cunning stratagems, this is not just their intention to do this, they merely fear the authority of Gaozu and Empress Lu. Now that they have already killed the Lü clan and shed fresh blood in the capital, this welcoming Your Majesty is just a pretext, in reality it cannot be trusted.' 'We urge Your Majesty to feign illness and not go, to observe how events develop.' Zhongwei Hong Chang advanced and said: 'The ministers' discussions are all wrong. When Qin lost its governance, the various feudal lords and powerful families rose up one by one, each considering himself to have the Mandate of Heaven, the number who considered themselves worthy reached tens of thousands, yet in the end, the one who ascended the imperial throne was Liu Bang, the world despaired, this is the first reason. Gaozu enfeoffed his sons and younger brothers with lands in a chessboard pattern to check each other, this is called the rock-solid foundation, the world respects its strength, this is the second reason. The Han rose and abolished Qin's harsh laws, simplified the statutes, bestowed kindness and favor, everyone felt at ease, difficult to shake, this is the third reason. Although Empress Lu was strict and established three Lü as kings, monopolizing power and controlling everything, yet Grand Commandant Zhou Bo entered the Northern Army with a single tally, one shout and the soldiers all bared their left arms, supporting the Liu clan and rebelling against the Lü, in the end exterminating them. This was bestowed by Heaven, not by human effort. Now if the ministers truly intend to rebel, the people will not support them, how can their party become unified?' At present, internally we have the relatives Zhu Hui and Dong Mu, externally we fear the strength of Wu, Chu, Huainan, Langye, Qi, and Dai.' 'At present, among Gaozu's sons, only the Kings of Huainan and Dai remain, moreover Your Majesty is the elder, sage, benevolent, and filial, renowned throughout the world, therefore the ministers, following the will of the world, wish to welcome and establish Your Majesty, Your Majesty should have no doubts.' The King of Dai reported this to the Empress Dowager, but still hesitated and could not decide. He divined with tortoise shell, the omen showed 'Great Horizontal'. The interpretation said: 'Great Horizontal Geng Geng, I am the Heavenly King, Xia Yu illuminated it.' The King of Dai said: 'I am already a king, why speak of being king again?' The diviner said: 'What is called Heavenly King is the Son of Heaven.' Thereupon the King of Dai sent his mother's younger brother Bo Zhao to see Marquis Jiang, Jiang Hou and others fully explained to Zhao the intention of welcoming and establishing the king. Bo Zhao returned and reported: 'It is true, there is no need to doubt.' The King of Dai then laughed and said to Hong Chang: 'Indeed as you said.' He ordered Hong Chang to ride in the same carriage, Zhang Wu and five others to ride in the post carriage, and set out for Chang'an. They halted at Gaoling, and sent Hong Chang to first go to Chang'an to observe the situation.

sentences.zh: 昌至渭橋，丞相以下皆迎。

translations.text: Hong Chang reached Weiqiao, the chancellor and below all came to welcome him.

sentences.zh: 宋昌還報。

translations.text: Hong Chang returned and reported.

sentences.zh: 代王馳至渭橋，群臣拜謁稱臣。

translations.text: The King of Dai sped to Weiqiao, the assembled ministers bowed and addressed him as subject.

sentences.zh: 代王下車拜。

translations.text: The King of Dai alighted from his carriage and bowed.

sentences.zh: 太尉勃進曰：「願請閒言。」

translations.text: Grand Commandant Bo advanced and said: 'Please permit private conversation.'

sentences.zh: 宋昌曰：「所言公，公言之。

translations.text: Hong Chang said: 'What you say is public, say it publicly; what you say is private, the king does not receive private matters.'

sentences.zh: 所言私，王者不受私。」

translations.text: The Grand Commandant then knelt and presented the imperial seal and tallies.

sentences.zh: 太尉乃跪上天子璽符。

translations.text: The King of Dai declined and said: 'Let us discuss it in the Dai residence.'

sentences.zh: 代王謝曰：「至代邸而議之。」

translations.text: He sped into the Dai residence.

sentences.zh: 遂馳入代邸。

translations.text: The ministers followed him in.

sentences.zh: 群臣從至。

translations.text: Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo, Grand General Chen Wu, Imperial Secretary Zhang Cang, Royal Secretary Liu Ying, Zhu Xu Marquis Liu Zhang, Dong Mu Marquis Liu Xingju, Jianke Liu Jie all bowed twice and said: 'Those called Hong and others are not the sons of Emperor Hui, they are not worthy to sacrifice at the ancestral temple.

sentences.zh: 丞相陳平、太尉周勃、大將軍陳武、御史大夫張蒼、宗正劉郢、朱虛侯劉章、東牟侯劉興居、典客劉揭皆再拜言曰：「子弘等皆非孝惠帝子，不當奉宗廟。

translations.text: We respectfully request to consult with the Yin'an Marquis, the marquis, the King of Langye, the imperial relatives, the great ministers, the marquises, the officials of two thousand shi, and say: "Your Majesty is Gaozu's eldest son, you should succeed Gaozu."

sentences.zh: 臣謹請（與）陰安侯列侯頃王后與瑯邪王、宗室、大臣、列侯、吏二千石議曰：『大王高帝長子，宜為高帝嗣。』

translations.text: We urge Your Majesty to ascend the imperial throne.'

sentences.zh: 願大王即天子位。」

translations.text: The King of Dai said: 'Serving Gaozu's ancestral temple is a heavy matter.

sentences.zh: 代王曰：「奉高帝宗廟，重事也。

translations.text: I am incompetent, insufficient to bear the ancestral temple.

sentences.zh: 寡人不佞，不足以稱宗廟。

translations.text: I request to consult with the King of Chu on what is appropriate, I dare not comply.'

sentences.zh: 願請楚王計宜者，寡人不敢當。」

translations.text: The ministers all prostrated themselves and firmly requested.

sentences.zh: 群臣皆伏固請。

translations.text: The King of Dai faced west and declined three times, faced south and declined twice.

sentences.zh: 代王西鄉讓者三，南鄉讓者再。

translations.text: Chancellor Chen Ping and others all said: 'We firmly believe that Your Majesty serving Gaozu's ancestral temple is most fitting, even if the world, all the feudal lords and people consider it fitting.

sentences.zh: 丞相平等皆曰：「臣伏計之，大王奉高帝宗廟最宜稱，雖天下諸侯萬民以為宜。

translations.text: We, for the sake of the ancestral temple and the altars of soil and grain, dare not be negligent.

sentences.zh: 臣等為宗廟社稷計，不敢忽。

translations.text: We urge Your Majesty to graciously heed us.

sentences.zh: 願大王幸聽臣等。

translations.text: We respectfully present the imperial seal and tallies again bowing twice.'

sentences.zh: 臣謹奉天子璽符再拜上。」

translations.text: The King of Dai said: 'The imperial relatives, generals, kings, marquises consider none more fitting than me, I dare not decline.'

sentences.zh: 代王曰：「宗室將相王列侯以為莫宜寡人，寡人不敢辭。」

translations.text: He then ascended the imperial throne.

sentences.zh: 遂即天子位。

translations.text: The ministers observed the rites and served in order.

Hong Chang reached Weiqiao, the chancellor and below all came to welcome him. Hong Chang returned and reported. The King of Dai sped to Weiqiao, the assembled ministers bowed and addressed him as subject. The King of Dai alighted from his carriage and bowed. Grand Commandant Bo advanced and said: 'Please permit private conversation.' Hong Chang said: 'What you say is public, say it publicly; what you say is private, the king does not receive private matters.' The Grand Commandant then knelt and presented the imperial seal and tallies. The King of Dai declined and said: 'Let us discuss it in the Dai residence.' He sped into the Dai residence. The ministers followed him in. Chancellor Chen Ping, Grand Commandant Zhou Bo, Grand General Chen Wu, Imperial Secretary Zhang Cang, Royal Secretary Liu Ying, Zhu Xu Marquis Liu Zhang, Dong Mu Marquis Liu Xingju, Jianke Liu Jie all bowed twice and said: 'Those called Hong and others are not the sons of Emperor Hui, they are not worthy to sacrifice at the ancestral temple. We respectfully request to consult with the Yin'an Marquis, the marquis, the King of Langye, the imperial relatives, the great ministers, the marquises, the officials of two thousand shi, and say: "Your Majesty is Gaozu's eldest son, you should succeed Gaozu." We urge Your Majesty to ascend the imperial throne.' The King of Dai said: 'Serving Gaozu's ancestral temple is a heavy matter. I am incompetent, insufficient to bear the ancestral temple. I request to consult with the King of Chu on what is appropriate, I dare not comply.' The ministers all prostrated themselves and firmly requested. The King of Dai faced west and declined three times, faced south and declined twice. Chancellor Chen Ping and others all said: 'We firmly believe that Your Majesty serving Gaozu's ancestral temple is most fitting, even if the world, all the feudal lords and people consider it fitting. We, for the sake of the ancestral temple and the altars of soil and grain, dare not be negligent. We urge Your Majesty to graciously heed us. We respectfully present the imperial seal and tallies again bowing twice.' The King of Dai said: 'The imperial relatives, generals, kings, marquises consider none more fitting than me, I dare not decline.' He then ascended the imperial throne. The ministers observed the rites and served in order.

sentences.zh: 群臣以禮次侍。

translations.text: He sent Taipu Ying and Dong Mu Marquis Xingju to clear the palace and receive the imperial carriage from the Dai residence.

sentences.zh: 乃使太仆嬰與東牟侯興居清宮，奉天子法駕，迎于代邸。

translations.text: The emperor entered the Weiyang Palace that very night.

sentences.zh: 皇帝即日夕入未央宮。

translations.text: That night he appointed Hong Chang as Wei General, guarding the northern and southern armies.

sentences.zh: 乃夜拜宋昌為衛將軍，鎮撫南北軍。

translations.text: He appointed Zhang Wu as Zhongwei Ling, patrolling within the palace.

sentences.zh: 以張武為郎中令，行殿中。

translations.text: He sat in the front hall.

sentences.zh: 還坐前殿。

translations.text: That night he issued an edict: 'Recently the Lü clan used their position to monopolize power and plotted great rebellion, intending to endanger the Liu clan's ancestral temple, relying on the marquises and ministers who killed them, all received their punishments.

sentences.zh: 於是夜下詔書曰：「閒者諸呂用事擅權，謀為大逆，欲以危劉氏宗廟，賴將相列侯宗室大臣誅之，皆伏其辜。

translations.text: I have just ascended the throne, I pardon the world, grant the people one degree of nobility, one hundred households of cattle and wine per woman, feast for five days.'

sentences.zh: 朕初即位，其赦天下，賜民爵一級，女子百戶牛酒，酺五日。」

translations.text: On Xinyou day, the emperor ascended the throne, visited the Gao Temple.

He sent Taipu Ying and Dong Mu Marquis Xingju to clear the palace and receive the imperial carriage from the Dai residence. The emperor entered the Weiyang Palace that very night. That night he appointed Hong Chang as Wei General, guarding the northern and southern armies. He appointed Zhang Wu as Zhongwei Ling, patrolling within the palace. He sat in the front hall. That night he issued an edict: 'Recently the Lü clan used their position to monopolize power and plotted great rebellion, intending to endanger the Liu clan's ancestral temple, relying on the marquises and ministers who killed them, all received their punishments. I have just ascended the throne, I pardon the world, grant the people one degree of nobility, one hundred households of cattle and wine per woman, feast for five days.' On Xinyou day, the emperor ascended the throne, visited the Gao Temple.

sentences.zh: 辛亥，皇帝即阼，謁高廟。

translations.text: All the lands of Qi and Chu that the Lü clan had taken were returned to them.

sentences.zh: 右丞相平徙為左丞相，太尉勃為右丞相，大將軍灌嬰為太尉。

translations.text: On Renzi day, he sent Cheqi General Bo Zhao to welcome the Empress Dowager from Dai.

sentences.zh: 諸呂所奪齊楚故地，皆復與之。

translations.text: The emperor said: 'Lü Chan set himself up as prime minister, Lü Lu as supreme general, falsely commanding Ying the General to lead troops to attack Qi, Ying halted at Chengyang and did not attack, cooperating with the feudal lords to plot against the Lü clan.

All the lands of Qi and Chu that the Lü clan had taken were returned to them. On Renzi day, he sent Cheqi General Bo Zhao to welcome the Empress Dowager from Dai. The emperor said: 'Lü Chan set himself up as prime minister, Lü Lu as supreme general, falsely commanding Ying the General to lead troops to attack Qi, Ying halted at Chengyang and did not attack, cooperating with the feudal lords to plot against the Lü clan.

sentences.zh: 壬子，遣車騎將軍薄昭迎皇太后於代。

translations.text: Lü Chan intended to do evil, Chancellor Chen Ping and Grand Commandant Zhou Bo plotted to seize Lü Chan and others' armies.

sentences.zh: 皇帝曰：「呂產自置為相國，呂祿為上將軍，擅矯遣灌將軍嬰將兵擊齊，欲代劉氏，嬰留滎陽弗擊，與諸侯合謀以誅呂氏。

translations.text: Zhu Xu Marquis Liu Zhang first captured Lü Chan and others.

sentences.zh: 呂產欲為不善，丞相陳平與太尉周勃謀奪呂產等軍。

translations.text: Grand Commandant Bo personally led Pinghou Tong to hold the tally and enter the Northern Army according to the edict.

sentences.zh: 朱虛侯劉章首先捕呂產等。

translations.text: Jianke Liu Jie personally seized Lü Lu's seal.

sentences.zh: 太尉身率襄平侯通持節承詔入北軍。

translations.text: Increase Grand Commandant Bo's fief by one thousand households, grant gold five thousand jin.

sentences.zh: 典客劉揭身奪趙王呂祿印。

translations.text: Chancellor Chen Ping, General Ying's fiefs each three thousand households, gold two thousand jin.

sentences.zh: 益封太尉勃萬戶，賜金五千斤。

translations.text: Zhu Xu Marquis Liu Zhang, Pinghou Tong, Dong Mu Marquis Liu Xingju's fiefs each two thousand households, gold one thousand jin.

sentences.zh: 丞相陳平、灌將軍嬰邑各三千戶，金二千斤。

translations.text: Enfeoff Jianke Jie as Yangxin Marquis, grant gold one thousand jin.'

sentences.zh: 朱虛侯劉章、襄平侯通、東牟侯劉興居邑各二千戶，金千斤。

translations.text: In the twelfth month, the emperor said: 'Law is the correct governance, it is used to prohibit violence and guide goodness.

sentences.zh: 封典客揭為陽信侯，賜金千斤。」

translations.text: Now those who violate the law have already been punished, but to make innocent parents and wives of the same clan as well as their concubines share in the punishment, and to confiscate property, I greatly disapprove.

Lü Chan intended to do evil, Chancellor Chen Ping and Grand Commandant Zhou Bo plotted to seize Lü Chan and others' armies. Zhu Xu Marquis Liu Zhang first captured Lü Chan and others. Grand Commandant Bo personally led Pinghou Tong to hold the tally and enter the Northern Army according to the edict. Jianke Liu Jie personally seized Lü Lu's seal. Increase Grand Commandant Bo's fief by one thousand households, grant gold five thousand jin. Chancellor Chen Ping, General Ying's fiefs each three thousand households, gold two thousand jin. Zhu Xu Marquis Liu Zhang, Pinghou Tong, Dong Mu Marquis Liu Xingju's fiefs each two thousand households, gold one thousand jin. Enfeoff Jianke Jie as Yangxin Marquis, grant gold one thousand jin.' In the twelfth month, the emperor said: 'Law is the correct governance, it is used to prohibit violence and guide goodness. Now those who violate the law have already been punished, but to make innocent parents and wives of the same clan as well as their concubines share in the punishment, and to confiscate property, I greatly disapprove.

sentences.zh: 十二月，上曰：「法者，治之正也，所以禁暴而率善人也。

translations.text: The officials all said: 'The people cannot govern themselves, therefore laws are established to prohibit them.

sentences.zh: 今犯法已論，而使毋罪之父母妻子同產坐之，及為收帑，朕甚不取。

translations.text: Joint punishment and confiscation of property serve to accumulate fear in their hearts, making them revere violating the law, this has come from afar.'

sentences.zh: 其議之。」

translations.text: The emperor said: 'I have heard that when the law is correct, the people obey; when punishment fits the crime, the people follow.

sentences.zh: 有司皆曰：「民不能自治，故為法以禁之。

translations.text: Moreover, those who shepherd and guide the people toward goodness are the officials.

sentences.zh: 相坐坐收，所以累其心，使重犯法，所從來遠矣。

translations.text: If they cannot guide them, yet use incorrect laws to punish them, this is to harm the people as violence.

sentences.zh: 如故便。」

translations.text: How can one prohibit it?

sentences.zh: 上曰：「朕聞法正則民愨，罪當則民從。

translations.text: I have not seen its benefit, whose opinion is this?'

sentences.zh: 且夫牧民而導之善者，吏也。

translations.text: The officials all said: 'Your Majesty adds great kindness, virtue is most abundant, not what we officials can reach.

sentences.zh: 其既不能導，又以不正之法罪之，是反害於民為暴者也。

Nearly approached correcting calendar, clothes, Feng and Shan sacrifices, but modesty and yielding not completed to now. Alas, how not benevolent!
